1.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

2.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

3.brief: the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
an entrance (the place or the act); specifically sunset or the west; also (adverb with preposition) towards
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

4.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

5.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

6.brief: to depress or sink (expectation figuratively, to humiliate, intransitive or transitive)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

7.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
a heap of rubbish or filth
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

8.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

9.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
sterile (as if extirpated in the generative organs)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
